subject: Art & Design
title: Sans-Serif: Clean, Modern, Universal
description: A quick, practical guide to Sans-Serif: Clean, Modern, Universal.

hook.text: 'Sans' means 'without' in French. Sans-serif fonts have no feet, no decorative strokes.

buildup.text: Helvetica (1957) and Arial became the default for modern corporate and digital communication.

discovery.text: On screens, especially at small sizes, sans-serifs are generally cleaner and more legible.

twist.text: When sans-serifs first appeared in the 1800s, critics called them 'grotesque.' The name stuck.

climax.text: Google, Apple, Microsoft â€” all switched their system fonts to custom sans-serifs in the 2010s.

punchline.text: They stripped the ornament. What remained was clarity.

quiz.question: Why are sans-serif fonts preferred for screens?
options: They're cleaner and more legible at small sizes
